intro: Echinocitrus brassii, commonly known as the African star gooseberry, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its spiny stems and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically green when unripe and turn red when mature. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a slightly rough texture, while its roots are fibrous and adapted to arid conditions. Echinocitrus brassii is often used in traditional medicine and is also cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance.
